api.generic package¶

Submodules¶

api.generic.constants module¶

Various constants and mappings.

api.generic.em module¶

class api.generic.em.Em(vendor, generic_config, adapter_config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class of generic functions representing operations exposed by the EM towards the Test Interface as defined by ETSI GS NFV-TST 002 v1.1.1 (2016-10).

get_operation_status(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function provides the status of a VNF lifecycle management operation.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.13 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:lifecycle_operation_occurrence_id – ID of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
Returns:The status of the operation ex. ‘Processing’, ‘Failed’.
modify_vnf_configuration(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function is exposed by the EM at the Em-tst interface and is used by the Test System to trigger ModifyConfiguration on the VNF from the EM (and through the VNFM).

This function is a re-exposure of the VNF Configuration Management interface offered by the VNF/VNFM over the Ve-Vnfm reference points. See ETSI GS NFV-IFA 008 v2.1.1 (2016-10) section 7.6.2.

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance.
  • vnf_configuration_data – Configuration data for the VNF instance.
  • ext_virtual_link – Information about external VLs to connect the VNF to.
  • vnfc_configuration_data – Configuration data related to VNFC instance(s).
Returns:

None.
poll_for_operation_completion(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function polls the status of an operation until it reaches a final state or time is up.

Parameters:
  • lifecycle_operation_occurrence_id – ID of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
  • final_states – List of states of the operation that when reached, the polling stops.
  • max_wait_time – Maximum interval of time in seconds to wait for the operation to reach a final state.
  • poll_interval – Interval of time in seconds between consecutive polls.
Returns:

Operation status.
set_generic_config(VNF_SCALE_TIMEOUT=360, POLL_INTERVAL=5)[source]¶
vnf_scale(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function is exposed by the EM at the Em-tst interface and is used by the Test System to trigger VNF scale operation and check results at the EM.

This function scales a VNF horizontally (out/in).

This function is a re-exposure of the VNF Lifecycle Management interface at the Ve-Vnfm-em reference point. See ETSI GS NFV-IFA 008 v2.1.1 (2016-10) section 7.2.4.

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to which this scaling request is related.
  • scale_type – Defines the type of the scale operation requested (scale out, scale in).
  • aspect_id – Identifies the aspect of the VNF that is requested to be scaled, as declared in the VNFD.
  • number_of_steps – Number of scaling steps to be executed as part of this ScaleVnf operation. Defaults to 1.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the scaling process, specific to the VNF being scaled.
Returns:

Identifier of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
vnf_scale_sync(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function synchronously scales a VNF horizontally (out/in).

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to which this scaling request is related.
  • scale_type – Defines the type of the scale operation requested. Possible values: ‘in’, or ‘out’
  • aspect_id – Identifies the aspect of the VNF that is requested to be scaled, as declared in the VNFD.
  • number_of_steps – Number of scaling steps to be executed as part of this ScaleVnf operation. Defaults to 1.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the scaling process, specific to the VNF being scaled.
Returns:

Operation status.
exception api.generic.em.EmGenericError[source]¶

Bases: api.generic.ApiGenericError

A problem occurred in the VNF LifeCycle Validation EM generic API.

api.generic.mano module¶

class api.generic.mano.Mano(vendor, generic_config, adapter_config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class of generic functions representing operations exposed by the MANO.

get_allocated_vresources(**kwargs)[source]¶

This functions retrieves the virtual resources allocated to the VNF with the provided instance ID.

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters used for filtering.
Returns:

Dictionary with the resources for each VNFC.
get_notification_queue(**kwargs)[source]¶
get_ns_ingress_cp_addr_list(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function goes through each VNF inside the NS with the provided instance ID and retrieves the destination address(es) for each connection point in the ingress_cp_list.

Parameters:
  • ns_info – NsInfo information element for the NS for which the ingress CP address list needs to be retrieved.
  • ingress_cp_list – List of connection points for which to get the corresponding address(es). Expected format: [‘VNF1:CP1:ip’, ‘VNF1:CP2:mac’, ‘VNF2:CP2:ip’ …]
Returns:

String containing space-separated addresses.
get_nsd_scaling_properties(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function returns the scaling properties for the provided scaling policy name from the NSD with the provided ID.

Parameters:
  • nsd_id – ID of the NSD to get the scaling properties from.
  • scaling_policy_name – Name of the scaling policy to get the properties for.
Returns:

Dictionary with the scaling properties.
get_operation_status(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function provides the status of a VNF lifecycle management operation.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.13 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:lifecycle_operation_occurrence_id – ID of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
Returns:The status of the operation ex. ‘Processing’, ‘Failed’.
get_vim_helper(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function returns an instance of Vim class :param vim_id: ID of the VIM as known by the MANO element :return: Vim object

get_vnf_ingress_cp_addr_list(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function retrieves from the provided VnfInfo information element the destination address(es) for each connection point in the ingress_cp_list.

Parameters:
  • vnf_info – VnfInfo information element for the VNF for which the ingress CP address list needs to be retrieved.
  • ingress_cp_list – List of connection points for which to get the corresponding address(es). Expected format: [‘CP1:ip’, ‘CP2:mac’, …]
Returns:

String with space-separated addresses.
get_vnf_instance_id_from_ns_vnf_name(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function retrieves from the provided NsInfo information element the VNF instance ID that corresponds to the VNF with the provided name.

Parameters:
  • ns_info – NsInfo information element for the NS that contains the VNF with the provided name.
  • vnf_name – Name of the VNF whose instance ID should be retrieved.
Returns:

String representing the VNF instance ID.
get_vnf_mgmt_addr_list(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function retrieves the management addresses of the VNFCs that belong to the VNF with the given instance ID.

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters used for filtering.
Returns:

List of management addresses.
get_vnfd_name_from_nsd_vnf_name(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function retrieves from the NSD with the provided instance ID the VNFD name that corresponds to the provided VNF name.

Parameters:
  • nsd_id – Identifier of the NSD from which to retrieve the VNFD name.
  • vnf_name – Name of the VNF whose VNFD name should be retrieved.
Returns:

String representing the name of the VNFD name.
get_vnfd_scaling_properties(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function returns the scaling properties for the provided scaling policy name from the VNFD with the provided ID.

Parameters:
  • vnfd_id – ID of the VNFD to get the scaling properties from.
  • scaling_policy_name – Name of the scaling policy to get the properties for.
Returns:

Dictionary with the scaling properties.
limit_compute_resources_for_ns_scaling(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function reserves compute resources so that the remaining resources are enough only for instantiating the NS defined by the provided nsd_id, with the provided number of default instances and scaling the NS desired_scale_out_steps times.

Parameters:
  • nsd_id – Identifier of the NSD which defines the NS.
  • scaling_policy_name – Name of the scaling policy as stated in the NSD.
  • desired_scale_out_steps – Desired number of steps the NS should be scaled out.
  • generic_vim_object – Generic VIM object.
Returns:

The reservation ID if the reservation was successful, None otherwise.
limit_compute_resources_for_vnf_instantiation(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function reserves compute resources so that the remaining resources are not enough for instantiating the VNF defined by the provided vnfd_id and with the provided number of default instances.

Parameters:
  • vnfd_id – Identifier of the VNFD which defines the VNF.
  • generic_vim_object – Generic VIM object.
  • limit_vcpus – Boolean, specifying whether vCPUs should be limited or not.
  • limit_vmem – Boolean, specifying whether vMemory should be limited or not.
  • limit_vc_instances – Boolean, specifying whether virtual container instances should be limited or not.
  • scaling_policy_name – Optional, name of the scaling policy as stated in the VNFD.
Returns:

The reservation ID if the reservation was successful, None otherwise.
limit_compute_resources_for_vnf_scaling(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function reserves compute resources so that the remaining resources are enough only for instantiating the VNF defined by the provided vnfd_id, and scaling the VNF desired_scale_out_steps times according to the provided scaling policy name.

Parameters:
  • vnfd_id – Identifier of the VNFD which defines the VNF.
  • scaling_policy_name – Name of the scaling policy as stated in the VNFD.
  • desired_scale_out_steps – Desired number of steps the VNF should be scaled out.
  • generic_vim_object – Generic VIM object.
Returns:

The reservation ID if the reservation was successful, None otherwise.
limit_storage_resources_for_vnf_instantiation(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function reserves storage resources so that the remaining resources are not enough for instantiating the VNF defined by the provided vnfd_id and with the provided number of default instances.

Parameters:
  • vnfd_id – Identifier of the VNFD which defines the VNF.
  • generic_vim_object – Generic VIM object.
  • scaling_policy_name – Optional, name of the scaling policy as stated in the VNFD.
Returns:

The reservation ID if the reservation was successful, None otherwise.
modify_vnf_configuration(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function enables providing configuration parameters information for a VNF instance.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.6.2 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance.
  • vnf_configuration_data – Configuration data for the VNF instance.
  • ext_virtual_link – Information about external VLs to connect the VNF to.
Returns:

None.
ns_create_and_instantiate(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function creates an NS instance ID and synchronously instantiates an NS.

Parameters:
  • nsd_id – Reference to the NSD used to create this NS instance.
  • ns_name – Human readable name of the NS instance.
  • ns_description – Human readable description of the NS instance.
  • flavour_id – Flavour of the NSD used to instantiate this NS.
  • sap_data – Create data concerning the SAPs of this NS.
  • pnf_info – Information on the PNF(s) that are part of this NS.
  • vnf_instance_data – Specify an existing VNF instance to be used in the NS.
  • nested_ns_instance_data – Specify an existing NS instance to be used as a nested NS within the NS.
  • location_constraints – Defines the location constraints for the VNF to be instantiated as part of the NS instantiation.
  • additional_param_for_ns – Allows the OSS/BSS to provide additional parameter(s) at the NS level.
  • additional_param_for_vnf – Allows the OSS/BSS to provide additional parameter(s) per VNF instance.
  • start_time – Timestamp indicating the earliest time to instantiate the NS.
  • ns_instantiation_level_id – Identifies one of the NS instantiation levels declared in the DF applicable to this NS instance.
  • additional_affinity_or_anti_affinity_rule – Specifies additional affinity or anti-affinity constraint for the VNF instances to be instantiated as part of the NS instantiation.
Returns:

Identifier of the NS instance.
ns_create_id(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function creates an NS instance ID and an associated instance of a NsInfo information element, identified by that identifier, in the NOT_INSTANTIATED state without instantiating the NS or doing any additional lifecycle operation(s).

This function was written in accordance with section 7.3.2 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:
  • nsd_id – Reference to the NSD used to create this NS instance.
  • ns_name – Human readable name of the NS instance.
  • ns_description – Human readable description of the NS instance.
Returns:

Identifier of the instance of an NS that has been created.
ns_delete_id(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function an NS instance identifier and the associated NsInfo information element.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.3.8 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:ns_instance_id – NS instance identifier to be deleted.
Returns:None
ns_get_alarm_list(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function enables the OSS/BSSs to query the active alarms from the NFVO.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.6.4 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.4.1 (2018-02).

Parameters:query_filter – Input filter for selecting alarms. This can contain the list of the NS identifiers, severity and cause.
Returns:Information about an alarm including AlarmId, affected NS Id, and FaultDetails. The cardinality can be “0” to indicate that no Alarm could be retrieved based on the input filter information.
ns_instantiate(**kwargs)[source]¶

This operation will instantiate an NS.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.3.3 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:
  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the instance of the NS.
  • flavour_id – Flavour of the NSD used to instantiate this NS.
  • sap_data – Create data concerning the SAPs of this NS.
  • pnf_info – Information on the PNF(s) that are part of this NS.
  • vnf_instance_data – Specify an existing VNF instance to be used in the NS.
  • nested_ns_instance_data – Specify an existing NS instance to be used as a nested NS within the NS.
  • location_constraints – Defines the location constraints for the VNF to be instantiated as part of the NS instantiation.
  • additional_param_for_ns – Allows the OSS/BSS to provide additional parameter(s) at the NS level.
  • additional_param_for_vnf – Allows the OSS/BSS to provide additional parameter(s) per VNF instance.
  • start_time – Timestamp indicating the earliest time to instantiate the NS.
  • ns_instantiation_level_id – Identifies one of the NS instantiation levels declared in the DF applicable to this NS instance.
  • additional_affinity_or_anti_affinity_rule – Specifies additional affinity or anti-affinity constraint for the VNF instances to be instantiated as part of the NS instantiation.
Returns:

Identifier of the NS lifecycle operation occurrence.
ns_instantiate_sync(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function performs a synchronous NS instantiation, i.e. instantiates an NS and then polls the operation status until the operation reaches a final state.

Parameters:
  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the instance of the NS.
  • flavour_id – Flavour of the NSD used to instantiate this NS.
  • sap_data – Create data concerning the SAPs of this NS.
  • pnf_info – Information on the PNF(s) that are part of this NS.
  • vnf_instance_data – Specify an existing VNF instance to be used in the NS.
  • nested_ns_instance_data – Specify an existing NS instance to be used as a nested NS within the NS.
  • location_constraints – Defines the location constraints for the VNF to be instantiated as part of the NS instantiation.
  • additional_param_for_ns – Allows the OSS/BSS to provide additional parameter(s) at the NS level.
  • additional_param_for_vnf – Allows the OSS/BSS to provide additional parameter(s) per VNF instance.
  • start_time – Timestamp indicating the earliest time to instantiate the NS.
  • ns_instantiation_level_id – Identifies one of the NS instantiation levels declared in the DF applicable to this NS instance.
  • additional_affinity_or_anti_affinity_rule – Specifies additional affinity or anti-affinity constraint for the VNF instances to be instantiated as part of the NS instantiation.
Returns:

Operation status.
ns_lifecycle_change_notification_subscribe(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function allows the OSS/BSS to subscribe to NS lifecycle change notifications, and the NFVO to provide such notifications to the subscriber.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.4.2 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:notification_filter – Input filter for selecting the notifications.
Returns:Identifier of the subscription realized.
ns_query(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function enables the OSS/BSS to query from the NFVO information on one or more NS(s). The operation also supports querying information about VNF instance(s) that is (are) part of an NS.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.3.6 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:
  • query_filter – Filter defining the NSs on which the query applies, based on attributes of the Network Service.
  • attribute_selector – Provides a list of attribute names of NS. If present, only these attributes are returned for the instances of NS matching the filter. If absent, the complete instances of NS(s) are returned.
Returns:

Information on the NS and VNF instances part of the NS matching the input filter. If attributeSelector is present, only the attributes listed in attributeSelector are returned for the selected NSs and VNF instances.
ns_scale(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function scales an NS instance.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.3.4 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:
  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the instance of the NS.
  • scale_type – Indicates the type of scaling to be performed. Possible values: ‘SCALE_NS, ‘SCALE_VNF’.
  • scale_ns_data – Provides the necessary information to scale the referenced NS instance. It shall be present when scale_type = ‘SCALE_NS’.
  • scale_vnf_data – Provides the information to scale a given VNF instance that is part of the referenced NS instance. Shall be present when scale_type = ‘SCALE_VNF’.
  • scale_time – Timestamp indicating the scale time of the NS, i.e. the NS will be scaled at this timestamp.
Returns:

Identifier of the NS lifecycle operation occurrence.
ns_scale_sync(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function synchronously scales an NS instance.

Parameters:
  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the instance of the NS.
  • scale_type – Indicates the type of scaling to be performed. Possible values: ‘SCALE_NS, ‘SCALE_VNF’.
  • scale_ns_data – Provides the necessary information to scale the referenced NS instance. It shall be present when scale_type = ‘SCALE_NS’.
  • scale_vnf_data – Provides the information to scale a given VNF instance that is part of the referenced NS instance. Shall be present when scale_type = ‘SCALE_VNF’.
  • scale_time – Timestamp indicating the scale time of the NS, i.e. the NS will be scaled at this timestamp.
Returns:

Operation status.
ns_terminate(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function terminates an NS.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.3.7 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.1.1 (2016-10). The additional_param input is not part of the standard specification.

Parameters:
  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the NS instance to terminate.
  • terminate_time – Timestamp indicating the end time of the NS, i.e. the NS will be terminated automatically at this timestamp.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the Terminate NS operation, specific to the NS being terminated.
Returns:

Identifier of the NS lifecycle operation occurrence.
ns_terminate_and_delete(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function synchronously terminates an NS and deletes its instance ID.

Parameters:
  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the NS instance to terminate.
  • terminate_time – Timestamp indicating the end time of the NS, i.e. the NS will be terminated automatically at this timestamp.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the Terminate NS operation, specific to the NS being terminated.
Returns:

‘SUCCESS’ if both operations were successful, ‘FAILED’ otherwise.
ns_terminate_sync(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function synchronously terminates an NS.

Parameters:
  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the NS instance to terminate.
  • terminate_time – Timestamp indicating the end time of the NS, i.e. the NS will be terminated automatically at this timestamp.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the Terminate NS operation, specific to the NS being terminated.
Returns:

Operation status.
ns_update(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function updates an NS instance. This operation is also used to embed VNF LCM operations in support of fine grained NS LCM approach. See the informative message flows in annex C. Actions that can be performed with an update include: - Adding existing VNF instances to the NS instance. - Removing VNF instances from the NS instance. - Instantiating new VNF instances and adding them to the NS instance. - Changing the DF of VNF instances belonging to the NS instance. - Changing the operational state of a VNF instance belonging to the NS instance. - Modifying information data and/or the configurable properties of a VNF instance belonging to the NS instance. - Changing the external connectivity of a VNF instance belonging to the NS instance. - Adding SAPs to the NS instance. - Removing SAPs from the NS instance. - Adding existing NS instances to the NS instance. - Removing nested NS instances from the NS instance. - Associate a new NSD version to the NS instance. - Moving VNF instances from one NS instance to another NS instance. - Adding VNFFGs to the NS instance. - Removing VNFFGs from the NS instance. - Update VNFFGs of the NS instance. - Changing the DF of the NS instance. Only one type of update shall be allowed per operation.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.3.5 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.3.1 (2017-08).

Parameters:
  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the NS instance being updated.
  • update_type – Specifies the type of update. This parameter determines also which one of the following parameter is present in the operation. Possible values are: - AddVnf (adding existing VNF instance(s)), - RemoveVnf (removing VNF instance(s)), - InstantiateVnf (instantiating new VNF(s)), - ChangeVnfDf (Changing VNF DF), - OperateVnf (changing VNF state), - ModifyVnfInformation (modifying VNF information and/or the configurable properties of VNF instance(s)), - ChangeExtVnfConnectivity (changing the external connectivity of VNF instance(s)) - AddSap (adding SAP(s)), - RemoveSap (removing SAP(s)), - AddNestedNs (adding existing NS instance(s) as nested NS(s)), - RemoveNestedNs (removing existing nested NS instance(s)), - AssocNewNsdVersion (associating a new NSD version to the NS instance), - MoveVnf (moving VNF instance(s) from one origin NS instance to a another target NS instance), - AddVnffg (adding VNFFG(s)), - RemoveVnffg (removing VNFFG(s)), - UpdateVnffg (updating VNFFG(s)), - ChangeNsDf (changing NS DF).
  • add_vnf_instance – Specify an existing VNF instance to be added to the NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AddVnf.
  • remove_vnf_instance_id – Specify an existing VNF instance to be removed from the NS instance. The parameter contains the identifier(s) of the VNF instances to be removed. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=RemoveVnf.
  • instantiate_vnf_data – Specify the new VNF to be instantiated. This parameter can be used e.g. for the bottom-up NS creation. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=InstantiateVnf.
  • change_vnf_flavour_data – Specify the new DF of the VNF instance to be changed to. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=ChangeVnfDf.
  • operate_vnf_data – Specify the state of the VNF instance to be changed. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=OperateVnf.
  • modify_vnf_info_data – Specify the VNF Information parameters and/or the configurable properties of VNF instance to be modified. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=ModifyVnfInformation.
  • change_ext_vnf_connectivity_data – Specify the new external connectivity data of the VNF instance to be changed. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=ChangeExtVnfConnectivity.
  • add_sap – Specify a new SAP to be added to the NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AddSap.
  • remove_sap_id – Specify an existing SAP to be removed from the NS instance. The parameter shall be present only if updateType=RemoveSap.
  • add_nested_ns_id – Specify an existing nested NS instance to be added to (nested within) the NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AddNestedNs.
  • remove_nested_ns_id – Specify an existing nested NS instance to be removed from the NS instance. The parameter shall be present only if updateType=RemoveVnfNestedNs.
  • assoc_new_nsd_version_data – Specify the new NSD to be used for the NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AssocNewNsdVersion.
  • move_vnf_instance_data – Specify existing VNF instance to be moved from one NS instance to another NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=MoveVnf.
  • add_vnffg – Specify the new VNFFG to be created to the NS Instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AddVnffg.
  • remove_vnffg_id – Identifier of an existing VNFFG to be removed from the NS Instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=RemoveVnffg.
  • update_vnffg – Specify the new VNFFG Information data to be updated for a VNFFG of the NS Instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=UpdateVnffg.
  • change_ns_flavour_data – Specifies the new DF to be applied to the NS instance. It shall be present only if updateType=ChangeNsDf.
  • update_time – Timestamp indicating the update time of the NS, i.e. the NS will be updated at this timestamp. Cardinality “0” indicates the NS update takes place immediately.
Returns:

Identifier of the NS lifecycle operation occurrence.
ns_update_sync(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function synchronously updates an NS instance.

Parameters:
  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the instance of the NS.
  • update_type – Specifies the type of update. See function ns_update for explanation of allowed values.
  • add_vnf_instance – Specify an existing VNF instance to be added to the NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AddVnf.
  • remove_vnf_instance_id – Specify an existing VNF instance to be removed from the NS instance. The parameter contains the identifier(s) of the VNF instances to be removed. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=RemoveVnf.
  • instantiate_vnf_data – Specify the new VNF to be instantiated. This parameter can be used e.g. for the bottom-up NS creation. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=InstantiateVnf.
  • change_vnf_flavour_data – Specify the new DF of the VNF instance to be changed to. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=ChangeVnfDf.
  • operate_vnf_data – Specify the state of the VNF instance to be changed. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=OperateVnf.
  • modify_vnf_info_data – Specify the VNF Information parameters and/or the configurable properties of VNF instance to be modified. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=ModifyVnfInformation.
  • change_ext_vnf_connectivity_data – Specify the new external connectivity data of the VNF instance to be changed. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=ChangeExtVnfConnectivity.
  • add_sap – Specify a new SAP to be added to the NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AddSap.
  • remove_sap_id – Specify an existing SAP to be removed from the NS instance. The parameter shall be present only if updateType=RemoveSap.
  • add_nested_ns_id – Specify an existing nested NS instance to be added to (nested within) the NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AddNestedNs.
  • remove_nested_ns_id – Specify an existing nested NS instance to be removed from the NS instance. The parameter shall be present only if updateType=RemoveVnfNestedNs.
  • assoc_new_nsd_version_data – Specify the new NSD to be used for the NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AssocNewNsdVersion.
  • move_vnf_instance_data – Specify existing VNF instance to be moved from one NS instance to another NS instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=MoveVnf.
  • add_vnffg – Specify the new VNFFG to be created to the NS Instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=AddVnffg.
  • remove_vnffg_id – Identifier of an existing VNFFG to be removed from the NS Instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=RemoveVnffg.
  • update_vnffg – Specify the new VNFFG Information data to be updated for a VNFFG of the NS Instance. This parameter shall be present only if updateType=UpdateVnffg.
  • change_ns_flavour_data – Specifies the new DF to be applied to the NS instance. It shall be present only if updateType=ChangeNsDf.
  • update_time – Timestamp indicating the update time of the NS, i.e. the NS will be updated at this timestamp. Cardinality “0” indicates the NS update takes place immediately.
Returns:

Operation status.
nsd_delete(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function will delete one or more NSD(s). The associated NSD information objects will be deleted as well.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.6 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.4.1 (2018-02).

Parameters:nsd_info_id – Identifier of the NSD information objects to be deleted.
Returns:Identifier of the deleted NSD information objects.
nsd_fetch(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function will fetch an NSD from the NFVO.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.17 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.4.1 (2018-02).

Parameters:nsd_info_id – Identifier of the NSD information object associated with the NSD to be fetched.
Returns:The fetched NSD.

This function will create an NSD information object in the NFVO for the NSD to be uploaded.

Parameters:user_defined_data – User defined data for the NSD to be uploaded.

nsd_info_query(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function will enable the OSS/BSS to query the NFVO concerning details of one or more NSD information objects.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.7 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 013 v2.4.1 (2018-02).

Parameters:
  • query_filter – Filter defining the NSD information objects on which the query applies, based on attributes of the NSD information objects. It can also be used to specify one or more NSD information objects to be queried by providing their identifiers.
  • attribute_selector – Provides a list of attribute names of the NSD information objects. If present, only these attributes are returned for the NSD information objects matching the filter. If absent, the complete NSD information objects are returned.
Returns:

Details of the NSD information objects matching the input filter.

  • nsd – NSD to be uploaded.

None.
poll_for_operation_completion(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function polls the status of an operation until it reaches a final state or time is up.

Parameters:
  • lifecycle_operation_occurrence_id – ID of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
  • final_states – List of states of the operation that when reached, the polling stops.
  • max_wait_time – Maximum interval of time in seconds to wait for the operation to reach a final state.
  • poll_interval – Interval of time in seconds between consecutive polls.
Returns:

Operation status.
resolve_ns_cp_addr(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function will search for pattern like ${vnf_name:cp_name:addr_type} (e.g ${VNF1:east:ip}) recursively inside ‘data’ and resolve them using information found in ‘ns_info’

Parameters:
  • ns_info – NsInfo information element.
  • data – Data structure containing patterns that may need resolving.
Returns:

Data structure with resolved patterns.

validate_ns_allocated_vresources(**kwargs)[source]¶

  • ns_instance_id – Identifier of the NS instance.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters used for filtering.
Returns:

True if the allocated resources are as expected, False otherwise.
validate_ns_instantiation_level(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function verifies that the number of VNFC instances for each VNF in the provided NsInfo information element matches the number of instances indicated by the instantiation level ID corresponding to that VNF.

If no instantiation level ID corresponds to a particular VNF, the number of VNFC instances for that VNF will be compared to the number of instances indicated by the default instantiation level ID corresponding to that VNF.

Parameters:
  • ns_info – NsInfo information element.
  • instantiation_level_list –

    List of dictionaries containing the VNF name and the corresponding target instantiation level ID. Example: [{‘target_vnf_name’: ‘empirix’,

    ’target_instantiation_level_id’: ‘scaled’}]
  • additional_param – Additional parameters used for filtering.
Returns:

True if the number of VNFC instances for each VNF is correct, False otherwise.
validate_ns_released_vresources(**kwargs)[source]¶

This functions validates that the resources allocated to an NS instance have been released.

Parameters:ns_info – NsInfo structure holding information about the NS instance.
Returns:True if the resources have been released, False otherwise.

validate_vnf_instantiation_level(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function verifies that the number of VNFC instances in the provided VnfInfo information element matches the number of instances indicated by the provided instantiation level ID of the current deployment flavor.

If the number of instances for a particular VDU is not present in the provided instantiation level ID, the number of instances for that VDU will be compared to the number of instances indicated by the default instantiation level ID of the current deployment flavor.

Parameters:
  • vnf_info – VnfInfo information element.
  • instantiation_level_id – ID of the instantiation level.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters used for filtering.
Returns:

True if the number of VNFC instances is correct, False otherwise.

  • vnf_info_final – VnfInfo structure holding information about the final state of the VNF instance

  • aspect_id – Provides the aspect of the NS that is requested to be scaled, as declared in the NSD.

vnf_change_flavour(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function changes the deployment flavour of a VNF instance.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.6 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.4.1 (2018-02).

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to be modified.
  • new_flavour_id – Identifier of the new VNF DF to apply to this VNF instance.
  • instantiation_level_id – Identifier of the instantiation level of the DF to be used. If not present, the default instantiation level as declared in the VNFD shall be used.
  • ext_virtual_link – Information about external VLs to connect the VNF to.
  • ext_managed_virtual_link – Information about internal VLs that are managed by other entities than the VNFM.
  • vim_connection_info – Information about VIM connection(s) for managing resources for the VNF instance, or external/externally-managed virtual links. This attribute shall be supported and present if VNF-related resource management in direct mode is applicable. In that case, this attribute shall be present if there is the need to communicate VIM connection information for external or externally-managed virtual links.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the flavour change process, specific to the VNF being modified as declared in the VNFD.
Returns:

Identifier of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
vnf_create_and_instantiate(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function creates a VNF instance ID and synchronously instantiates a VNF.

Parameters:
  • vnfd_id – Identifier that identifies the VNFD which defines the VNF instance to be created.
  • flavour_id – Identifier of the VNF DF to be instantiated.
  • vnf_instance_name – Human-readable name of the VNF instance to be created.
  • vnf_instance_description – Human-readable description of the VNF instance to be created.
  • instantiation_level_id – Identifier of the instantiation level of the DF to be instantiated. If not present, the default instantiation level as declared in the VNFD shall be instantiated.
  • ext_virtual_link – Information about external VLs to connect the VNF to.
  • ext_managed_virtual_link – Information about internal VLs that are managed by other entities than the VNFM.
  • localization_language – Localization language of the VNF to be instantiated.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed as input to the instantiation process, specific to the VNF being instantiated.
Returns:

Identifier of the VNF instance.
vnf_create_id(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function creates a VNF instance ID and an associated instance of a VnfInfo information element, identified by that identifier, in the NOT_INSTANTIATED state without instantiating the VNF or doing any additional lifecycle operation(s).

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.2 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:
  • vnfd_id – Identifier that identifies the VNFD which defines the VNF instance to be created.
  • vnf_instance_name – Human-readable name of the VNF instance to be created.
  • vnf_instance_description – Human-readable description of the VNF instance to be created.
Returns:

VNF instance identifier just created.

  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance.

  • instantiation_level_id – Identifier of the instantiation level of the DF to be instantiated. If not present, the default instantiation level as declared in the VNFD shall be instantiated.
  • ext_virtual_link – Information about external VLs to connect the VNF to.
  • ext_managed_virtual_link – Information about internal VLs that are managed by other entities than the VNFM.

  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed as input to the instantiation process, specific to the VNF being instantiated.

vnf_instantiate_sync(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function performs a synchronous VNF instantiation, i.e. instantiates a VNF and then polls the operation status until the operation reaches a final state.

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance.
  • flavour_id – Identifier of the VNF DF to be instantiated.
  • instantiation_level_id – Identifier of the instantiation level of the DF to be instantiated. If not present, the default instantiation level as declared in the VNFD shall be instantiated.
  • ext_virtual_link – Information about external VLs to connect the VNF to.
  • ext_managed_virtual_link – Information about internal VLs that are managed by other entities than the VNFM.
  • localization_language – Localization language of the VNF to be instantiated.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed as input to the instantiation process, specific to the VNF being instantiated.
Returns:

Operation status.
vnf_lifecycle_change_notification_subscribe(**kwargs)[source]¶
vnf_operate(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function changes the state of a VNF instance.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.11 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.1.6 (2017-06).

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance.
  • change_state_to – Desired state to change the VNF to. Permitted values are: start, stop.
  • stop_type – It signals whether forceful or graceful stop is requested. Possible values: ‘forceful’ and ‘graceful’.
  • graceful_stop_timeout – Time interval to wait for the VNF to be taken out of service during graceful stop, before stopping the VNF.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the Operate VNF operation, specific to the VNF being operated.
Returns:

Identifier of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
vnf_operate_sync(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function performs a synchronous change of a VNF state.

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance.
  • change_state_to – Desired state to change the VNF to. Permitted values are: start, stop.
  • stop_type – It signals whether forceful or graceful stop is requested. Possible values: ‘forceful’ and ‘graceful’.
  • graceful_stop_timeout – Time interval to wait for the VNF to be taken out of service during graceful stop, before stopping the VNF.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the Operate VNF operation, specific to the VNF being operated.
Returns:

Operation status.
vnf_query(**kwargs)[source]¶

This operation provides information about VNF instances. The applicable VNF instances can be chosen based on filtering criteria, and the information can be restricted to selected attributes.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.9 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:
  • query_filter – Filter to select the VNF instance(s) about which information is queried.
  • attribute_selector – Provides a list of attribute names. If present, only these attributes are returned for the VNF instance(s) matching the filter. If absent, the complete information is returned for the VNF instance(s) matching the filter.
Returns:

The information items about the selected VNF instance(s) that are returned. If attribute_selector is present, only the attributes listed in attribute_selector are returned for the selected VNF instance(s).
vnf_scale(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function scales a VNF horizontally (out/in).

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.4 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to which this scaling request is related.
  • scale_type – Defines the type of the scale operation requested (scale out, scale in).
  • aspect_id – Identifies the aspect of the VNF that is requested to be scaled, as declared in the VNFD.
  • number_of_steps – Number of scaling steps to be executed as part of this ScaleVnf operation. Defaults to 1.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the scaling process, specific to the VNF being scaled.
Returns:

Identifier of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
vnf_scale_sync(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function synchronously scales a VNF horizontally (out/in).

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to which this scaling request is related.
  • scale_type – Defines the type of the scale operation requested. Possible values: ‘in’, or ‘out’
  • aspect_id – Identifies the aspect of the VNF that is requested to be scaled, as declared in the VNFD.
  • number_of_steps – Number of scaling steps to be executed as part of this ScaleVnf operation. Defaults to 1.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the scaling process, specific to the VNF being scaled.
Returns:

Operation status.
vnf_scale_to_level(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function scales an instantiated VNF of a particular DF to a target size.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.5 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.1.1 (2016-10).

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to which this scaling request is related.
  • instantiation_level_id – Identifier of the target instantiation level of the current DF to which the VNF is requested to be scaled. Either instantiationLevelId or scaleInfo but not both shall be present.
  • scale_info – For each scaling aspect of the current DF, defines the target scale level to which the VNF is to be scaled. Either instantiationLevelId or scaleInfo but not both shall be present.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed as input to the scaling process, specific to the VNF being scaled.
Returns:

Identifier of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.

This function synchronously scales an instantiated VNF of a particular DF to a target size.

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to which this scaling request is related.
  • instantiation_level_id – Identifier of the target instantiation level of the current DF to which the VNF is requested to be scaled. Either instantiationLevelId or scaleInfo but not both shall be present.
  • scale_info – For each scaling aspect of the current DF, defines the target scale level to which the VNF is to be scaled. Either instantiationLevelId or scaleInfo but not both shall be present.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed as input to the scaling process, specific to the VNF being scaled.
Returns:

Operation status.
vnf_terminate(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function terminates a VNF.

This function was written in accordance with section 7.2.7 of ETSI GS NFV-IFA 007 v2.1.6 (2017-06).

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to be terminated.
  • termination_type – Signals whether forceful or graceful termination is requested.
  • graceful_termination_timeout – The time interval to wait for the VNF to be taken out of service during graceful termination, before shutting down the VNF and releasing the resources.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the Terminate VNF operation, specific to the VNF being terminated.
Returns:

Identifier of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
vnf_terminate_and_delete(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function synchronously terminates a VNF and deletes its instance ID.

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to be terminated.
  • termination_type – Signals whether forceful or graceful termination is requested.
  • graceful_termination_timeout – The time interval to wait for the VNF to be taken out of service during graceful termination, before shutting down the VNF and releasing the resources.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the Terminate VNF operation, specific to the VNF being terminated.
Returns:

‘SUCCESS’ if both operations were successful, ‘FAILED’ otherwise.

configure(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function applies the new traffic load and traffic configurations. If the traffic already flows, the parameters get applied at run time.

Parameters:
  • traffic_load – Possible values: ‘LOW_TRAFFIC_LOAD’, ‘NORMAL_TRAFFIC_LOAD’, ‘MAX_TRAFFIC_LOAD’, ‘INITIAL’, ‘PERCENTAGE’
  • traffic_config – Specific information required to run the traffic.
Returns:

True if traffic load and configuration parameter were applied, False otherwise.
destroy(**kwargs)[source]¶
does_traffic_flow(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function checks if packets are received. Dropped packets may occur, but are not considered as a negative outcome of the function. If all packets get dropped, the function fails.

Parameters:delay_time – Time, in seconds, to wait until polling for traffic.
Returns:True if traffic flow is detected, False otherwise

start(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function starts the traffic emission.

Parameters:
  • delay_time – Time, in seconds, to wait until starting traffic.
  • return_when_emission_starts – Flag influencing if the command should return back immediately or only when the emission actually started.
Returns:

True if emission stared, False otherwise.

This function stops the traffic emission.

Parameters:
  • delay_time – Time, in seconds, to wait until stopping traffic.
  • return_when_emission_stops – Flag influencing if the command should return back immediately or only when the emission actually stopped.
Returns:

Parameters:lifecycle_operation_occurrence_id – ID of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
Returns:Status of the operation ex. ‘Processing’, ‘Failed’.

Returns:True if the license has been applied successfully, False otherwise.
poll_for_operation_completion(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function polls the status of an operation until it reaches a final state or time is up.

Parameters:
  • lifecycle_operation_occurrence_id – ID of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
  • final_states – List of states of the operation that when reached, the polling stops.
  • max_wait_time – Maximum interval of time in seconds to wait for the operation to reach a final state.
  • poll_interval – Interval of time in seconds between consecutive polls.
Returns:

Operation status.
scale(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function is exposed by the VNF at the Vnf-tst interface and is used by the Test System to trigger VNF scale operation at the VNF.

This function is a re-exposure of the VNF Lifecycle Management interface at the Ve-Vnfm-vnf reference point. See ETSI GS NFV-IFA 008 v2.1.1 (2016-10) section 7.2.4.

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to which this scaling request is related.
  • scale_type – Defines the type of the scale operation requested (scale out, scale in).
  • aspect_id – Identifies the aspect of the VNF that is requested to be scaled, as declared in the VNFD.
  • number_of_steps – Number of scaling steps to be executed as part of this ScaleVnf operation. Defaults to 1.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the scaling process, specific to the VNF being scaled.
Returns:

Identifier of the VNF lifecycle operation occurrence.
scale_sync(**kwargs)[source]¶

This function synchronously scales the VNF horizontally (out/in).

Parameters:
  • vnf_instance_id – Identifier of the VNF instance to which this scaling request is related.
  • scale_type – Defines the type of the scale operation requested. Possible values: ‘in’, or ‘out’
  • aspect_id – Identifies the aspect of the VNF that is requested to be scaled, as declared in the VNFD.
  • number_of_steps – Number of scaling steps to be executed as part of this ScaleVnf operation. Defaults to 1.
  • additional_param – Additional parameters passed by the NFVO as input to the scaling process, specific to the VNF being scaled.
  • poll_interval – Interval of time in seconds between consecutive polls on the scaling operation result.
Returns:

Operation status.
exception api.generic.vnf.VnfGenericError[source]¶

Bases: api.generic.ApiGenericError

A problem occurred in the VNF LifeCycle Validation VNF generic API.

Module contents¶

exception api.generic.ApiGenericError[source]¶

Bases: api.ApiError

A problem occurred in the VNF LifeCycle Validation generic API.

api.generic.construct_generic(vendor, module_type, **kwargs)[source]¶

This function fetches the adapter constructor for the specified vendor and module type.

Parameters:
  • vendor – The name of the vendor of the module. Ex “openstack”
  • module_type – The module type for which to fetch the constructor. Ex. “vnfm”
  • kwargs – Additional key-value pairs.
Returns:

The constructor for the specified vendor and module type.
